00029 TEST(State, Basic) {
00030   State state;
00031   Rule* rule = new Rule("cat");
00032   string err;
00033   EXPECT_TRUE(rule->ParseCommand("cat $in > $out", &err));
00034   ASSERT_EQ("", err);
00035   state.AddRule(rule);
00036   Edge* edge = state.AddEdge(rule);
00037   state.AddIn(edge, "in1");
00038   state.AddIn(edge, "in2");
00039   state.AddOut(edge, "out");
00040 
00041   EXPECT_EQ("cat in1 in2 > out", edge->EvaluateCommand());
00042 
00043   EXPECT_FALSE(state.GetNode("in1")->dirty());
00044   EXPECT_FALSE(state.GetNode("in2")->dirty());
00045   EXPECT_FALSE(state.GetNode("out")->dirty());
00046 }
00047 
00048 struct TestEnv : public Env {
00049   virtual string LookupVariable(const string& var) {
00050     return vars[var];
00051   }
00052   map<string, string> vars;
00053 };
00054 TEST(EvalString, PlainText) {
00055   EvalString str;
00056   string err;
00057   EXPECT_TRUE(str.Parse("plain text", &err));
00058   EXPECT_EQ("", err);
00059   EXPECT_EQ("plain text", str.Evaluate(NULL));
00060 }
00061 TEST(EvalString, OneVariable) {
00062   EvalString str;
00063   string err;
00064   EXPECT_TRUE(str.Parse("hi $var", &err));
00065   EXPECT_EQ("", err);
00066   EXPECT_EQ("hi $var", str.unparsed());
00067   TestEnv env;
00068   EXPECT_EQ("hi ", str.Evaluate(&env));
00069   env.vars["var"] = "there";
00070   EXPECT_EQ("hi there", str.Evaluate(&env));
00071 }
00072 TEST(EvalString, OneVariableUpperCase) {
00073   EvalString str;
00074   string err;
00075   EXPECT_TRUE(str.Parse("hi $VaR", &err));
00076   EXPECT_EQ("", err);
00077   EXPECT_EQ("hi $VaR", str.unparsed());
00078   TestEnv env;
00079   EXPECT_EQ("hi ", str.Evaluate(&env));
00080   env.vars["VaR"] = "there";
00081   EXPECT_EQ("hi there", str.Evaluate(&env));
00082 }
00083 TEST(EvalString, Error) {
00084   EvalString str;
00085   string err;
00086   size_t err_index;
00087   EXPECT_FALSE(str.Parse("bad $", &err, &err_index));
00088   EXPECT_EQ("expected variable after $", err);
00089   EXPECT_EQ(5u, err_index);
00090 }
00091 TEST(EvalString, CurlyError) {
00092   EvalString str;
00093   string err;
00094   size_t err_index;
00095   EXPECT_FALSE(str.Parse("bad ${bar", &err, &err_index));
00096   EXPECT_EQ("expected closing curly after ${", err);
00097   EXPECT_EQ(9u, err_index);
00098 }
00099 TEST(EvalString, Curlies) {
00100   EvalString str;
00101   string err;
00102   EXPECT_TRUE(str.Parse("foo ${var}baz", &err));
00103   EXPECT_EQ("", err);
00104   TestEnv env;
00105   EXPECT_EQ("foo baz", str.Evaluate(&env));
00106   env.vars["var"] = "barbar";
00107   EXPECT_EQ("foo barbarbaz", str.Evaluate(&env));
00108 }
00109 TEST(EvalString, Dollars) {
00110   EvalString str;
00111   string err;
00112   EXPECT_TRUE(str.Parse("foo$$bar$bar", &err));
00113   ASSERT_EQ("", err);
00114   TestEnv env;
00115   env.vars["bar"] = "baz";
00116   EXPECT_EQ("foo$barbaz", str.Evaluate(&env));
00117 }

00119 struct StatTest : public StateTestWithBuiltinRules,
00120                   public DiskInterface {
00121   // DiskInterface implementation.
00122   virtual int Stat(const string& path);
00123   virtual bool MakeDir(const string& path) {
00124     assert(false);
00125     return false;
00126   }
00127   virtual string ReadFile(const string& path, string* err) {
00128     assert(false);
00129     return "";
00130   }
00131   virtual int RemoveFile(const string& path) {
00132     assert(false);
00133     return 0;
00134   }
00135 
00136   map<string, time_t> mtimes_;
00137   vector<string> stats_;
00138 };
00139 
00140 int StatTest::Stat(const string& path) {
00141   stats_.push_back(path);
00142   map<string, time_t>::iterator i = mtimes_.find(path);
00143   if (i == mtimes_.end())
00144     return 0;  // File not found.
00145   return i->second;
00146 }
00147 
00148 TEST_F(StatTest, Simple) {
00149   ASSERT_NO_FATAL_FAILURE(AssertParse(&state_,
00150 "build out: cat in\n"));
00151 
00152   Node* out = GetNode("out");
00153   out->file_->Stat(this);
00154   ASSERT_EQ(1u, stats_.size());
00155   Edge* edge = out->in_edge_;
00156   edge->RecomputeDirty(NULL, this, NULL);
00157   ASSERT_EQ(2u, stats_.size());
00158   ASSERT_EQ("out", stats_[0]);
00159   ASSERT_EQ("in",  stats_[1]);
00160 }
00161 
00162 TEST_F(StatTest, TwoStep) {
00163   ASSERT_NO_FATAL_FAILURE(AssertParse(&state_,
00164 "build out: cat mid\n"
00165 "build mid: cat in\n"));
00166 
00167   Node* out = GetNode("out");
00168   out->file_->Stat(this);
00169   ASSERT_EQ(1u, stats_.size());
00170   Edge* edge = out->in_edge_;
00171   edge->RecomputeDirty(NULL, this, NULL);
00172   ASSERT_EQ(3u, stats_.size());
00173   ASSERT_EQ("out", stats_[0]);
00174   ASSERT_TRUE(GetNode("out")->dirty_);
00175   ASSERT_EQ("mid",  stats_[1]);
00176   ASSERT_TRUE(GetNode("mid")->dirty_);
00177   ASSERT_EQ("in",  stats_[2]);
00178 }
00179 
00180 TEST_F(StatTest, Tree) {
00181   ASSERT_NO_FATAL_FAILURE(AssertParse(&state_,
00182 "build out: cat mid1 mid2\n"
00183 "build mid1: cat in11 in12\n"
00184 "build mid2: cat in21 in22\n"));
00185 
00186   Node* out = GetNode("out");
00187   out->file_->Stat(this);
00188   ASSERT_EQ(1u, stats_.size());
00189   Edge* edge = out->in_edge_;
00190   edge->RecomputeDirty(NULL, this, NULL);
00191   ASSERT_EQ(1u + 6u, stats_.size());
00192   ASSERT_EQ("mid1", stats_[1]);
00193   ASSERT_TRUE(GetNode("mid1")->dirty_);
00194   ASSERT_EQ("in11", stats_[2]);
00195 }
00196 
00197 TEST_F(StatTest, Middle) {
00198   ASSERT_NO_FATAL_FAILURE(AssertParse(&state_,
00199 "build out: cat mid\n"
00200 "build mid: cat in\n"));
00201 
00202   mtimes_["in"] = 1;
00203   mtimes_["mid"] = 0;  // missing
00204   mtimes_["out"] = 1;
00205 
00206   Node* out = GetNode("out");
00207   out->file_->Stat(this);
00208   ASSERT_EQ(1u, stats_.size());
00209   Edge* edge = out->in_edge_;
00210   edge->RecomputeDirty(NULL, this, NULL);
00211   ASSERT_FALSE(GetNode("in")->dirty_);
00212   ASSERT_TRUE(GetNode("mid")->dirty_);
00213   ASSERT_TRUE(GetNode("out")->dirty_);
00214 }

00216 #ifdef _WIN32
00217 #ifndef _mktemp_s
00218 /// mingw has no mktemp.  Implement one with the same type as the one
00219 /// found in the Windows API.
00220 int _mktemp_s(const char* templ) {
00221   char* ofs = strchr(templ, 'X');
00222   sprintf(ofs, "%d", rand() % 1000000);
00223   return 0;
00224 }
00225 #endif
00226 
00227 /// Windows has no mkdtemp.  Implement it in terms of _mktemp_s.
00228 char* mkdtemp(char* name_template) {
00229   int err = _mktemp_s(name_template);
00230   if (err < 0) {
00231     perror("_mktemp_s");
00232     return NULL;
00233   }
00234 
00235   err = _mkdir(name_template);
00236   if (err < 0) {
00237     perror("mkdir");
00238     return NULL;
00239   }
00240 
00241   return name_template;
00242 }
00243 #endif
00244 
00245 class DiskInterfaceTest : public testing::Test {
00246 public:
00247   virtual void SetUp() {
00248     // Because we do real disk accesses, we create a temp dir within
00249     // the system temporary directory.
00250 
00251     // First change into the system temp dir and save it for cleanup.
00252     start_dir_ = GetSystemTempDir();
00253     ASSERT_EQ(0, chdir(start_dir_.c_str()));
00254 
00255     // Then create and change into a temporary subdirectory of that.
00256     temp_dir_name_ = MakeTempDir();
00257     ASSERT_FALSE(temp_dir_name_.empty());
00258     ASSERT_EQ(0, chdir(temp_dir_name_.c_str()));
00259   }
00260 
00261   virtual void TearDown() {
00262     // Move out of the directory we're about to clobber.
00263     ASSERT_EQ(0, chdir(start_dir_.c_str()));
00264 #ifdef _WIN32
00265     ASSERT_EQ(0, system(("rmdir /s /q " + temp_dir_name_).c_str()));
00266 #else
00267     ASSERT_EQ(0, system(("rm -rf " + temp_dir_name_).c_str()));
00268 #endif
00269   }
00270 
00271   string GetSystemTempDir() {
00272 #ifdef _WIN32
00273     char buf[1024];
00274     if (!GetTempPath(sizeof(buf), buf))
00275       return "";
00276     return buf;
00277 #else
00278     const char* tempdir = getenv("TMPDIR");
00279     if (tempdir)
00280       return tempdir;
00281     return "/tmp";
00282 #endif
00283   }
00284 
00285   string MakeTempDir() {
00286     char name_template[] = "DiskInterfaceTest-XXXXXX";
00287     char* name = mkdtemp(name_template);
00288     return name ? name : "";
00289   }
00290 
00291   string start_dir_;
00292   string temp_dir_name_;
00293   RealDiskInterface disk_;
00294 };
00295 
00296 TEST_F(DiskInterfaceTest, Stat) {
00297   EXPECT_EQ(0, disk_.Stat("nosuchfile"));
00298 
00299 #ifdef _WIN32
00300   // TODO: find something that stat fails on for Windows.
00301 #else
00302   string too_long_name(512, 'x');
00303   EXPECT_EQ(-1, disk_.Stat(too_long_name));
00304 #endif
00305 
00306 #ifdef _WIN32
00307   ASSERT_EQ(0, system("cmd.exe /c echo hi > file"));
00308 #else
00309   ASSERT_EQ(0, system("touch file"));
00310 #endif
00311   EXPECT_GT(disk_.Stat("file"), 1);
00312 }

00314 TEST_F(DiskInterfaceTest, ReadFile) {
00315   string err;
00316   EXPECT_EQ("", disk_.ReadFile("foobar", &err));
00317   EXPECT_EQ("", err);
00318 
00319   const char* kTestFile = "testfile";
00320   FILE* f = fopen(kTestFile, "wb");
00321   ASSERT_TRUE(f);
00322   const char* kTestContent = "test content\nok";
00323   fprintf(f, "%s", kTestContent);
00324   ASSERT_EQ(0, fclose(f));
00325 
00326   EXPECT_EQ(kTestContent, disk_.ReadFile(kTestFile, &err));
00327   EXPECT_EQ("", err);
00328 }

00330 TEST_F(DiskInterfaceTest, MakeDirs) {
00331   EXPECT_TRUE(disk_.MakeDirs("path/with/double//slash/"));
00332 }

00334 TEST_F(DiskInterfaceTest, RemoveFile) {
00335   const char* kFileName = "file-to-remove";
00336 #ifdef _WIN32
00337   string cmd = "cmd /c echo hi > ";
00338 #else
00339   string cmd = "touch ";
00340 #endif
00341   cmd += kFileName;
00342   ASSERT_EQ(0, system(cmd.c_str()));
00343   EXPECT_EQ(0, disk_.RemoveFile(kFileName));
00344   EXPECT_EQ(1, disk_.RemoveFile(kFileName));
00345   EXPECT_EQ(1, disk_.RemoveFile("does not exist"));
00346 }
